sources.note: Main marketing page. Describes Practice EHR as cloud-based all-in-one EHR/PM/RCM for medical practices. Lists core features: EHR, PM, RCM, e-prescribing, patient portal, kiosk, telehealth, mobile app. Mentions 23+ specialties.

ONC certification disclosure page for Practice EHR V12. Certified 2022-06-28 under 2015 Edition Cures Act. Notes Open API R4 and DataMotion dependencies. Mentions integration fees for immunization registries and lab interfaces.
Company info. Plano, TX headquarters. Claims 20+ years helping practices. No specific customer count or employee number disclosed. Mentions Capterra and Software Advice awards.

Practice management feature page. Scheduling for multiple providers/locations, automated reminders, electronic superbills, claim scrubbing (98% clean rate), claim submission to 16,000+ payers, ERA processing, eligibility verification, patient statements, KPI dashboards.

Medical billing and RCM page. Integrated clearinghouse, denial/appeals management, payment posting, staffed RCM services with certified billers/coders. Emphasizes transparency and financial dashboards.

Charting feature page. Template library by specialty, point-and-click/free text/dictation, lab ordering/receipt, clinical decision support, clinical alerts, auto-population of encounter forms from templates.

Patient portal feature page. Patients access medical history, prescriptions, lab results, immunizations, diagnoses. Can request appointments, refills, view statements, make payments, send secure messages.
E-prescribing feature page. EPCS-certified, Surescripts-certified. Medication history access, formulary/eligibility/benefits checking, drug interaction checking, renewal automation.
Kiosk feature page. iPad-based self-service check-in. Patients enter demographics, family/social history, insurance, consent forms. Customizable by specialty. Data syncs to patient chart.
Specialty page listing 23 supported specialties from bariatric to urology. Emphasizes universal capabilities (scheduling, documentation, billing) applicable across all specialties.

Integration marketplace. Partners include Surescripts, Exostar (EPCS auth), TigerView (imaging), Quest/Labcorp/regional labs, ELLKAY (data integration), TokBox (video), RevSpring (statements), DataMotion (secure messaging), Alpha II (MIPS), Global Payments, PointClickCare, and multiple billing service partners.

Enterprise features. Multi-client/multi-location management, roll-up reporting, batch processing, extensive claim scrubbing, document management with archiving/indexing. Claims support for tens of thousands of users.
Integrated clearinghouse page. Connected to 16,000+ payers. Automates billing processes.
2026 blog post. Mentions new AI suite launch for reducing admin workload and optimizing RCM. COO Taha Mughal quoted. Capterra Shortlist 2026 recognition based on verified reviews.

Third-party review aggregator. 59 reviews, 4/5 stars, 85% satisfaction. Pricing from $179/provider/month. Features listed: charting, e-prescribing, scheduling, portal, telemedicine, billing. Users praise ease of use; criticize excessive clicking and billing issues post-updates.

Capterra review page (accessed via search results). Users highlight tailored templates, automated claim scrubbing, scheduling ease, and e-prescribing convenience. Concerns about support responsiveness and note-taking workflow.
ZoomInfo company profile (accessed via search). Reports ~$17M revenue, 51-200 employees, Plano TX headquarters. Founded 2014.
Kona Equity company profile (via search). Lists $17M revenue estimate for Practice EHR LLC.
